result.execSummary:
The defendant Kimberly A. Oberman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $233.87 paid directly to the Clerk of Court's Office prior to sentencing.  The 10% surcharge in the amount of $23.39 still due and owing - same repayment conditions apply as noted below for the Costs.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
No DNA sample ordered however, mandatory DNA Surcharge assessed.
Time sentence with credit for 2 days of prior time served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kimberly A. Oberman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:18 PM: Defendant Kimberly A. Oberman in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Defendant Kimberly A. Oberman in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Defendant in compliance with Deferred SEH agreement.  Chapter 950 in compliance.  $233.87 Restitution has been paid.  Per SPD:  Joint recommendation for resolution.  Court entertains waiver of personal appearance.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of personal appearance.  Statement by Defendant:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts joint recommendation and imposes 2 days WCJ - 2 days TS credit.  Court Costs ordered with Restitution recognizing that $233.87 was paid up front - 60 DTP Court Costs or PP.  No DNA Sample to be provided, however DNA surcharge ordered.  Appeal Rights faxed over to the Jailer for SPD.

Case Called @ 3:55 PM: Defendant Kimberly A. Oberman not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In light of nonappearance, warrant authorized.  Court notes full Restitution has been PIF w/COC and in light of expected Deferred SEH agreement, willing to accomodate Defendant if contact is made as to nonappearance.
by USPS - Moved, left no address - Unable to Forward

Case called @ 2:22 p.m. Defendant Kimberly A. Oberman in court with attorney Michael Ross Blum.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of Deferred Sentencing Agreement. Recess for the DE to speak with her attorney.

Case recalled @ 2:31 p.m. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. DA Blader - Restitution summary filed and the victim is in agreement to having the restitution amended to 1/2 of what was filed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and stays JOC. Ct 2 - DRI.  Court accepts terms and conditions of Deferred Sentencing Agreement.  Matter stayed for 9 months. The court reminds the defendant that the bond remains in place throughout the pendency of the Deferred Sentencing Agreement.

ADDRESS INFO for Kimberly A. Oberman
Current: 331 S Grove St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 04-02-2015)
Prior: 139 E. High Street, Wautoma, WI 54982

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Michael Ross Blum in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Blum requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Restitution Summary w/Preliminary Statements of Loss/Damage - $77.00
Status conference on March 9, 2015 at 02:20 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:08 p.m. Defendant Kimberly A. Oberman in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. NGP entered. DA Blader requesting $1000 Sig Bond. Atty Szilagyi voices no objection to the bond but requests a one time visit to the residence to obtain property. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond. The court suggests that the defendant coordinate any property retrieval through her probation agent. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 02:20 pm.
